SL Green Realty Corp. Announces Common Stock DividendSL Green Realty Corp. SLG, Manhattan's largest office landlord, today announced that its board of directors has declared a monthly dividend of $0.295 per share of common stock. The dividend is payable on June 15, 2020 to shareholders of record at the

A lot of deals either died or are on hold." The crisis has weighed on the shares of SL Green Realty and Vornado Realty Trust, two of the city's largest landlords. Together, the companies have seen more than $US5 billion ($7.8 billion) in market value evaporate since the beginning of March. Vornado was cut to sell by an analyst at Stifel on Wednesday. "What we've been doing is buying meals from restaurants throughout the city, right now we have nine restaurants signed up," explains Harry Sitomer. Sitomer is part of the Food First program started by SL Green Realty. The effort is also boosting restaurants during the crisis. "A very important part of the program is getting people back up and running and kitchens back up and running and people employed again," Sitomer explains.
